reviewText: I remember Arthur being much more fun, the laughs a lot quicker, Dudley Moores character laugh being less annoying.  Nothings as good as the memory of it...I never liked the sequel, it was never funny to me, the only reason I bought it was that by buying the two, the package was cheaper than buying Arthur by itself.  I still enjoyed it, a nice meandering stroll down memory lane, but it isn't the movie I'd watch over and over-like Caddyshack, I could watch that all day long!
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: For anyone who needs a good laugh!!!!  It also puts you on a roller coaster ride of emotions as Dudley is having to face the facts of trying to "Grow UP". It is well worth a re-watch.
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: Hail to Dudley Moore! He could be funny, charismatic, clever, sensitive, romantic and talented.  These two movies highlight all of this and more. He must have been very self-assured. No camera tricks or leading ladies standing in trenches to make him seem taller.  It was never questioned by movie-goers why the statuesque leading ladies would choose him over the tall handsome hunks.  Who could resist his wit and debonair charm.  Gone too soon; but living on in celluloid memories. Kudos to Liza Minnelli! Her wide-eyed kookiness and sensitivity act as a perfect foil to Dudley's "poor little rich man" in these films.
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: How fun is to have millions without working?arthur knows best, very funny movie,a classic from the 80's.have everything!!

Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: For the price this is definately worth it. It comes on 2 discs in one case, a must have for comedy fans like me. Dudley Moore is at his best in these to classic 80's comedy hits. This is a plus considering that it's on 2 discs and not on the single 2 sided disc that seems to get scratched all the time and you have to decide which side of the disc you want to keep in good mint condition.
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewerName: Jason P. Pumphrey "the movie & music man"
reviewText: Classic comedy in a great DVD 2 pack!!! Includes the classic "Arthur" (in Standard Full Frame) and the equally great sequel "Arthur 2: On The Rocks"(in 1.85 Anamorphic Widescreen). Great acting from the late Dudley Moore,along with stellar performances by Liza Manelli,and John Gielgud. If you want great classic comedy,you cant go wrong with this Arthur 2 pack!!! Some might gripe about the original in Standard Full Frame,that's a monor quibble here since the film was shot close to "flat" anyway. Recommended! A GREAT PRICE FOR BOTH FILMS ON DVD!!! Recommended! A+
summary: Don't you wish you were Arthur?
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: I got this because it has both  movies 1 and 2 on it. Both are great, funny and sad situations
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: Dudley Moore at his irresistible best!  I (thankfully) never saw the recent remake of "Arthur"...which I'm sure couldn't hold a shot glass to this original.  The comment from Arthur's father calling him a "millionaire drunk playboy" tells it all, but to me the movie belongs to Sir John Gielgud in the role of Arthur's "servant" Hobson.  Some of the best lines are delivered by Sir John, and I won't spoil the surprise by quoting them here."Arthur 2 On the Rocks" is an OK sequel, but doesn't carry the weight of the first.Packaging was great and delivered prior to the original promised date.  I highly recommend this!!
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewText: Dudley Moore and Liza Minnelli are great in both these movies. Arthur was a rich man who never grew up and was very wealthy. Dudley Moore was a great comedian. It's such a shame that he died at an early age. He had so much potential.

reviewText: I just love these movies! Great feel good, funny, laugh a minute movie to just curl up on the couch and laugh at. Dudley Moore plays a hilarious drunk. I never get sick of hearing, "He's taking the knife outta the cheese, you think he wants some cheese"? Love, love, love, the butler in "Arthur". Dudley and Liza are the perfect pair!
summary: Makes me laugh every time I watch these.
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks

reviewerName: Roy Anderson "War Buff - and civilian combatt...
reviewText: Arthur is a classic movie and most people will thoroughly enjoy it. Dudley Moore is superb - but John Gielgud is better!  'Arthur' is a first rate movie and, by itself, Arthur fully deserves 5 stars.Sadly, the same can't be said of 'Arthur 2'. In spite of this being almost a rehash of 'Arthur' - which, as I said, was an excellent movie - I give it 4 stars because it is still very funny...........in places. However, the script is too predictable and the acting undistinguished - with the notable exception of John Gielgud who excels naturally.  (John Gielgud could gain a deserved Oscar, for reading his breakfast Corn Flakes packet!)Those who thoroughly enjoyed Arthur, will enjoy the sequel movie - but don't expect any real 'class' to emerge - other than from Gielgud!
summary: Second movies usually fail - this one too.
Title: Arthur / Arthur 2: On The Rocks
